de.esoco.gwt.server

Class DataElementFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.gwt.server.DataElementFactory

  • public class DataElementFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory class that provides methods to create and manipulate instances of DataElement.

    • Constructor Summary

      • createAttributeName

        public static java.lang.String createAttributeName(de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<?,?> rFunction,
                                                   java.lang.String sPrefix)
        Creates an identifying name from an attribute function. If the given function is an instance of FunctionChain the identifier will be generated by recursive invocations of this method.
        Parameters:
        rFunction - The attribute function to create the identifier from
        sPrefix - An optional prefix for the generated name (empty string for none)
        Returns:
        The resulting column identifier

      • createSelectionDataElement

        public static de.esoco.data.element.SelectionDataElement createSelectionDataElement(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                                    java.lang.String sCurrentValue,
                                                                                    java.lang.String sPrefix,
                                                                                    de.esoco.entity.EntityDefinition<?> rEntityDefinition,
                                                                                    java.util.List<de.esoco.data.element.HierarchicalDataObject> aDataObjects,
                                                                                    java.util.Collection<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?>> rAttributes,
                                                                                    boolean bDisplayEntityIds)
        Creates a new SelectionDataElement for the selection from a list of data objects.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the element
        sCurrentValue - The currently selected value
        sPrefix - The prefix to be prepended to generated names
        rEntityDefinition - The entity definition for the objects or NULL for none
        aDataObjects - rEntities The entities to select from
        rAttributes - The entity attributes to display
        bDisplayEntityIds - TRUE to display entity IDs instead of string descriptions for entity attributes
        Returns:
        A new data element for the selection of an entity

      • createStringDataElement

        public static de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement createStringDataElement(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                              java.lang.Object rValue,
                                                                              java.util.Collection<?> rAllowedValues,
                                                                              java.util.Set<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement.Flag> rFlags)
        Creates a new string data element with a certain value. The meta data argument will be queried for a relation of the type ProcessRelationTypes.ALLOWED_VALUES that will constrain the possible values of the data element.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the data element
        rValue - The initial value of the element
        rAllowedValues - The allowed values to create a validator for or NULL for none
        rFlags - The optional data element flags
        Returns:
        The new data element

      • processAttributeFunction

        public static de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?> processAttributeFunction(de.esoco.entity.EntityDefinition<?> rEntityDefinition,
                                                                                                          de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?> fGetAttr,
                                                                                                          boolean bDisplayEntityIds)
        Converts an attribute access function (typically a relation type) into a function that provides a translated attribute value if necessary. This method will convert attributes that reference certain datatypes like entities, enums, or dates into special access functions.
        Parameters:
        rEntityDefinition - The entity definition of the attribute
        fGetAttr - The attribute access functions
        bDisplayEntityIds - TRUE to display entity IDs instead of string descriptions for entity attributes
        Returns:
        Either the original function or a function that performs the necessary transformation

      • processAttributeFunctions

        public static java.util.List<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?>> processAttributeFunctions(de.esoco.entity.EntityDefinition<?> rEntityDefinition,
                                                                                                                           java.util.Collection<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?>> rAttributes,
                                                                                                                           boolean bDisplayEntityIds)
        Converts a list of attribute access functions (typically relation types) into functions that provide a translated attribute value if necessary. This method will convert attributes that reference certain datatypes like entities, enums, or dates into special access functions.
        Parameters:
        rEntityDefinition - The entity definition of the attributes
        rAttributes - The list of attribute access functions
        bDisplayEntityIds - TRUE to display entity IDs instead of string descriptions for entity attributes
        Returns:
        A list containing either the original functions or functions that perform the necessary transformations

      • applyDataElement

        public void applyDataElement(de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> rElement,
                             org.obrel.core.Relatable rTarget,
                             org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rType)
                      throws AuthenticationException,
                             de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Applies a single data element to a relatable object by mapping the element back to the corresponding relation from which it had been created.
        Parameters:
        rElement - The data element to apply
        rTarget - The relatable object to apply the data element to
        rType - The type of the relation to apply
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If the current user is not authenticated
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If accessing storage data fails

      • applyDataElements

        public void applyDataElements(java.util.List<? extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> rSourceElements,
                              org.obrel.core.Relatable rTarget)
                       throws AuthenticationException,
                              de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Applies a set of data elements to a relatable object by mapping the element back to the corresponding relation from which it had been created. Immutable elements will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        rSourceElements - The list of data elements to apply
        rTarget - The relatable object to apply the data elements to
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If the current user is not authenticated
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If accessing storage data fails

      • createDataElementList

        public de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList createDataElementList(org.obrel.core.Relatable rObject,
                                                                   org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rType,
                                                                   java.util.Collection<?> rValues,
                                                                   java.util.Set<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement.Flag> rFlags)
                                                            throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Creates a list data element that contains data elements that are created from a collection of values. The collection can either contain relation types that will be converted to data elements recursively or other values which will be converted to strings. If the value collection argument is NULL the returned list data element will be empty.
        Parameters:
        rObject - The target object of the collection relation
        rType - The collection relation type
        rValues - A collection containing the values to be converted into data elements (may be NULL)
        rFlags - The optional data element flags
        Returns:
        The new list data element
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If creating data elements recursively fails

      • createEntityDataObject

        public de.esoco.data.element.HierarchicalDataObject createEntityDataObject(de.esoco.entity.Entity rEntity,
                                                                           int nIndex,
                                                                           de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity> pChildCriteria,
                                                                           de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity> pSortCriteria,
                                                                           de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<de.esoco.entity.Entity,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> fGetColumnData,
                                                                           java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> rFlags,
                                                                           boolean bHierarchical)
                                                                    throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Creates a data object for a certain entity in a storage query.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to create the data element from
        nIndex - The index of the data object
        pChildCriteria - A predicate that constrains the child entities to be included in a hierarchical object or NULL for none
        pSortCriteria - The sort criteria for child queries (NULL for none)
        fGetColumnData - The function to extract the entity's column data into a list of strings
        rFlags - The flags for the entity object
        bHierarchical - TRUE, to include children of the same type as the entity
        Returns:
        The resulting data element
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If creating the data object fails

      • createEntitySelectionElement

        public de.esoco.data.element.SelectionDataElement createEntitySelectionElement(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                               org.obrel.core.Relatable rMetaData,
                                                                               java.lang.Number rCurrentEntityId,
                                                                               java.util.List<de.esoco.entity.Entity> rEntities,
                                                                               java.util.List<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?>> rAttributes)
                                                                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Creates a new SelectionDataElement for the selection of a entity data element from a list of entities.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the element
        rMetaData - A relatable object containing the meta data for the element to create
        rCurrentEntityId - sCurrentValue The current selection or NULL for none
        rEntities - The entities to select from
        rAttributes - The entity attributes to display
        Returns:
        A new data element for the selection of an entity
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If initializing the query fails

      • createEntitySelectionElement

        public <E extends de.esoco.entity.Entity> de.esoco.data.element.SelectionDataElement createEntitySelectionElement(java.lang.String sName,
                                                                                                                  org.obrel.core.Relatable rMetaData,
                                                                                                                  java.lang.Number rCurrentEntityId,
                                                                                                                  int nCurrentSelection,
                                                                                                                  de.esoco.storage.QueryPredicate<E> pQuery,
                                                                                                                  de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pDefaultCriteria,
                                                                                                                  de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pDefaultSortCriteria,
                                                                                                                  java.util.List<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super de.esoco.entity.Entity,?>> rAttributes)
                                                                                                           throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Creates a new SelectionDataElement for the selection of a entity data element from a list of entities that is defined by a storage.
        Parameters:
        sName - The name of the element
        rMetaData - A relatable object containing the meta data for the element to create
        rCurrentEntityId - rCurrentValue The current selection or NULL for none
        nCurrentSelection - The index of the current selection or -1
        pQuery - The query for the entities to select from
        pDefaultCriteria - An optional predicate containing default criteria to be used if no specific query constraints are provided
        pDefaultSortCriteria - An optional predicate containing default sort criteria to be used if no specific sort fields are provided
        rAttributes - The entity attributes to query and display
        Returns:
        A new data element for the selection of an entity
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If registering the query storage adapter fails

      • getDataElement

        public de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> getDataElement(org.obrel.core.Relatable rObject,
                                                           org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rType)
                                                    throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Returns a data element for a certain relation of a relatable object. If the given object is an instance of ProcessStep this method invokes ProcessFragment.getParameterRelation(RelationType) to query the relation to also take into account parameters that are stored in the step's process.
        Parameters:
        rObject - The related object to query the relation from
        rType - The type of the relation to convert into a data element
        Returns:
        The data element or NULL if it could not be mapped
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the initialization of a storage-based data element fails

      • getDataElements

        public java.util.List<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> getDataElements(org.obrel.core.Relatable rObject,
                                                                            java.util.Collection<? extends org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rTypes,
                                                                            java.util.Set<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement.Flag> rFlags)
                                                                     throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Creates the data elements for certain relations of a relatable object. For each relation a single data element will be created by invoking the method getDataElement(Relatable, RelationType). If that method returns NULL no data element will be added to the result for the respective relation.
        Parameters:
        rObject - The related object to query the relations from
        rTypes - The relation types to create data elements for
        rFlags - The optional flags for each data element
        Returns:
        A new list containing the resulting data elements
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the initialization of a storage-based data element fails

      • applyStringList

        protected void applyStringList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rValues,
                               java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype,
                               java.util.Collection<?> rTargetCollection)
        Applies a list of string values by converting the values according to the given datatype and storing them in a collection.
        Parameters:
        rValues - The values to apply
        rDatatype - The target datatype
        rTargetCollection - The collection to store the converted values in
